Package infodynamics.measures.discrete

Class MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.discrete.InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
      • infodynamics.measures.discrete.MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DualTotalCorrelationCalculatorDiscrete, OInfoCalculatorDiscrete, SInfoCalculatorDiscrete
    public abstract class MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
extends InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
    Implements a base class with common functionality for child class implementations of multivariate information measures.

    Multivariate information measures are functionals of probability distributions over R^n, and typical examples include multi-information (a.k.a. total correlation), dual total correlation, O-information, and connected information.

    Usage of child classes is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator;
    2. Initialise the calculator using initialise();
    3. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using one or more calls to sets of #addObservations(int[][], int[]) methods, then
    4. Compute the required quantities, being one or more of:
      • the average measure: computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
    5. Return to step 2 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.

    References:

    • Rosas, F., Mediano, P., Gastpar, M, Jensen, H., "Quantifying high-order interdependencies via multivariate extensions of the mutual information", Physical Review E 100, (2019) 032305.
    Author:
    Pedro A.M. Mediano (email, www)

    • Field Detail

      • jointCount

        protected int[] jointCount
        Count of occurrences of each joint state in the provided observations.

      • smallMarginalCounts

        protected int[][] smallMarginalCounts
        Count of occurrences of each state of each variable in the provided observations. For a given variable v and state i, smallMarginalCounts[v][i] counts how many times variable v was observed in state i,

      • bigMarginalCounts

        protected int[][] bigMarginalCounts
        Count of occurrences of each state of each (D-1)-dimensional marginal in the provided observations. For a given variable v and state i, bigMarginalCounts[v][i] counts how many times the _rest_ of the system, excluding variable v, was observed in state i,

      • numVars

        protected int numVars
        Number of variables in the system.

      • jointStates

        protected int jointStates
        Number of possible states of the whole system.

      • checkedFirst

        protected boolean checkedFirst
        Whether the first local value has been checked. (Used to initialise some variables related to computation of local values.

        protected MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete​(int base,
                                                    int numVars)
        Abstract constructor (to be called by child classes).
        Parameters:
        base - number of symbols for each variable. E.g. binary variables are in base-2.
        numVars - numbers of joint variables that the measure will be computed over.
